definition[0]: failure to take enough care over something that you are responsible for
example[0]: negligence in carrying out safety procedures
example[1]: The bridge’s architect was sued for criminal negligence.
definition[1]: failure to take enough care over something that you are responsible for, for which you may have to pay DAMAGES
example[2]: The captain of the ship was accused of negligence in carrying out safety procedures.
example[3]: The jury found the company guilty of gross (=very serious) negligence and awarded the dead man’s family $10 million.
